str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To declare openly, proclaim, preach, laud, celebrate. From kata and the base of aggelos; to proclaim, promulgate.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Perhaps as the same as erethizo; properly, intrigue, i.e. faction.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Purely, sincerely, with pure motives, honestly. Adverb from hagnos; purely, i.e. Honestly.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To think, suppose, expect, imagine. Or oimai middle voice apparently from hoios; to make like, i.e. Imagine.
(a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
Persecution, affliction, distress, tribulation. From thlibo; pressure.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Or desmos des-mos' neuter and masculine respectively from deo; a band, i.e. Ligament or shackle; figuratively, an impediment or disability.
